subject: Career
title: The First 30 Seconds
description: A micro-lesson that makes The First 30 Seconds usable.

hook.text: Researchers found interviewers often decide in the first 30 seconds. The rest is confirmation.

buildup.text: Your handshake, eye contact, and opening words create an anchor the brain won't easily update.

discovery.text: This is the anchoring effect ‚Äî first data point shapes all future interpretation.

twist.text: A stumbled greeting can be overcome, but it costs you energy fighting uphill the entire interview.

climax.text: Prepare your first sentence like a speech. Practice it until it's natural.

punchline.text: First impressions aren't fair. But they're real.

quiz.question: What cognitive bias makes the first 30 seconds so critical?
